question: <image 1> In Table 10.18, the left column is the time we can go to work without eating breakfast and not feel tired. The column on the right is the time to work after breakfast without feeling tired. Calculate t-value.
description:
The image displays a table labeled "Table 10.18," which consists of two columns: "Work hours with breakfast" and "Work hours without breakfast." Each row in the table corresponds to a pair of values representing the number of work hours for each condition. Here's the data presented in the table:

| Work hours with breakfast | Work hours without breakfast |
|---------------------------|------------------------------|
| 8                         | 6                            |
| 7                         | 5                            |
| 9                         | 5                            |
| 5                         | 4                            |
| 9                         | 7                            |
| 8                         | 7                            |
| 10                        | 7                            |
| 7                         | 5                            |
| 6                         | 6                            |
| 9                         | 5                            |

The question asks for the calculation of the t-value using this data, where the left column represents the work hours when breakfast is consumed, and the right column represents the work hours when breakfast is skipped. The options provided for the t-value are A. 4.5963, B. 4.6963, C. 4.7963, and D. 4.8963.
